refnamediv.refpurpose: This API provides functions to provide su and sudo functionality to its users.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: enum GksuError
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GKSU_ERROR_XAUTH, GKSU_ERROR_HELPER, GKSU_ERROR_NOCOMMAND, GKSU_ERROR_NOPASSWORD, GKSU_ERROR_FORK, GKSU_ERROR_EXEC, GKSU_ERROR_PIPE, GKSU_ERROR_PIPEREAD, GKSU_ERROR_WRONGPASS, GKSU_ERROR_CHILDFAILED, GKSU_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED, GKSU_ERROR_CANCELED, GKSU_ERROR_WRONGAUTOPASS } GksuError;

refsect2.title: gksu_context_new ()
refsect2.para: This function should be used when creating a new GksuContext to pass to gksu_su_full or gksu_sudo_full. The GksuContext must be freed with gksu_context_free.

listitem.simpara: a newly allocated GksuContext

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_user ()
refsect2.para: Sets up what user the command will be run as. The default is root, but you can run the command as any user.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
the target username

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_user ()
refsect2.para: Gets the user the command will be run as, as set by gksu_context_set_user.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext from which to grab the information
a string with the user or NULL if not set.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_command ()
refsect2.para: Sets up what command will run with the target user.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
the command that shall be ran

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_command ()
refsect2.para: Gets the command that will be run, as set by gksu_context_set_command.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext from which to grab the information
a string with the command or NULL if not set.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_keep_env ()
refsect2.para: Should the environment be kept as it is? Defaults to TRUE. Notice that setting this to FALSE may cause the X authorization stuff to fail.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
TRUE or FALSE

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_keep_env ()
refsect2.para: Finds out if the environment in which the program will be run will be reset.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext from which to grab the information
TRUE if the environment is going to be kept, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_description ()
refsect2.para: Get the description that the window will have when the default function for requesting the password is called.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to get the description from.
a string with the description or NULL if not set.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_description ()
refsect2.para: Set the nice name for the action that is being run that the window that asks for the password will have. This is only meant to be used if the default window is used, of course.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
a string to set the description for

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_message ()
refsect2.para: Set the message that the window that asks for the password will have. This is only meant to be used if the default window is used, of course.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
a string to set the message for

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_message ()
refsect2.para: Get the message that the window will have when the default function for requesting the password is called.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to get the message from.
a string with the message or NULL if not set.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_login_shell ()
refsect2.para: Should the shell in which the command will be run be a login shell?

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
TRUE or FALSE

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_login_shell ()
refsect2.para: Finds out if the shell created by the underlying su process will be a login shell.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext from which to grab the information
TRUE if the shell will be a login shell, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_grab ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if gksu has been asked to do a grab on keyboard and mouse when asking for the password.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to ask whether a grab will be done.
TRUE if yes, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_set_debug ()
refsect2.para: Set up if debuging information should be printed.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext you want to modify
TRUE or FALSE

refsect2.title: gksu_context_get_debug ()
refsect2.para: Finds out if the library is configured to print debuging information.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext from which to grab the information
TRUE if it is, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gksu_context_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the given GksuContext.

listitem.simpara: the GksuContext to be freed.

refsect2.title: gksu_run ()
refsect2.para: This function is a wrapper for gksu_sudo/gksu_su. It will call one of them, depending on the GConf key that defines whether the default behavior for gksu is su or sudo mode. This is the recommended way of using the library functionality.

listitem.simpara: the command line that will be executed as other user
a GError to be set with the error condition, if an error happens
FALSE if all went well, TRUE if an error happend.

refsect2.title: gksu_run_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gksu_run_full (GksuContext *context, GksuAskPassFunc ask_pass, gpointer ask_pass_data, GksuPassNotNeededFunc pass_not_needed, gpointer pass_not_needed_data, GError **error);
refsect2.para: This is a compatibility shim over gksu_run_fuller, which, for compatibility reasons, lacks the 'exit_status' argument.

listitem.simpara: a GksuContext
a GksuAskPassFunc to be called when the lib determines requesting a password is necessary; it may be NULL, in which case the standard password request dialog will be used
a gpointer with user data to be passed to the GksuAskPasswordFunc

a GksuPassNotNeededFunc that will be called when the command is being run without the need for requesting a password; it will only be called if the display-no-pass-info gconf key is enabled; NULL will have the standard dialog be shown
a gpointer with the user data to be passed to the GksuPasswordNotNeededFunc
a GError object to be filled with the error code or NULL
TRUE if all went fine, FALSE if failed

refsect2.title: gksu_su ()
refsect2.para: This function is a wrapper for gksu_su_run_full. It will call it without giving the callback functions, which leads to the standard ones being called. A simple GksuContext is created to hold the user name and the command.

listitem.simpara: the command line that will be executed as other user
a GError to be set with the error condition, if an error happens
TRUE if all went well, FALSE if an error happend.

refsect2.title: gksu_su_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gksu_su_full (GksuContext *context, GksuAskPassFunc ask_pass, gpointer ask_pass_data, GksuPassNotNeededFunc pass_not_needed, gpointer pass_not_needed_data, GError **error);
refsect2.para: This is a compatibility shim over gksu_su_fuller, which, for compatibility reasons, lacks the 'exit_status' argument. You should check the documentation for gksu_su_fuller for information about the arguments.

listitem.simpara: a GksuContext
a GksuAskPassFunc to be called when the lib determines requesting a password is necessary; it may be NULL, in which case the standard password request dialog will be used
a gpointer with user data to be passed to the GksuAskPasswordFunc

a GksuPassNotNeededFunc that will be called when the command is being run without the need for requesting a password; it will only be called if the display-no-pass-info gconf key is enabled; NULL will have the standard dialog be shown
a gpointer with the user data to be passed to the GksuPasswordNotNeededFunc
a GError object to be filled with the error code or NULL
TRUE if all went fine, FALSE if failed

refsect2.para: This is a compatibility shim over gksu_sudo_fuller, which, for compatibility reasons, lacks the 'exit_status' argument. You should check the documentation for gksu_sudo_fuller for information about the arguments.

listitem.simpara: a GksuContext
a GksuAskPassFunc to be called when the lib determines requesting a password is necessary; it may be NULL, in which case the standard password request dialog will be used

refsect2.title: gksu_ask_password ()
refsect2.para: This function uses the gksu infra-structure to request for a password, but instead of passing it to su or sudo to run a command it simply returns the password. This is just a convenience wrapper for gksu_ask_password_full.

listitem.simpara: a GError to be set with the error condition, if an error happens
a newly allocated string with the password;

refsect2.title: gksu_ask_password_full ()
refsect2.para: This function uses the gksu infra-structure to request for a password, but instead of passing it to su or sudo to run a command it simply returns the password.

listitem.simpara: a GksuContext
a prompt different from Password:
a GError object to be filled with the error code or NULL
a newly allocated string with the password;
